body: Thanks @qinliujie, please @vongosling @stevenschew help review.

@shroman it's ok surely.
Please @lizhanhui @stevenschew help review this pr.
review Ok
review ok.
review ok
it's good idea, review ok
Hi, @qinliujie  This PR will be merged soon, but next time please send PR from branch ROCKETMQ-33 instead of master.
@zhouxinyu OK.
@qinliujie , I can't find your Github email from https://github.com/qinliujie, could you please provide it for me which is need in merge process.

![image](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/1527648/21756759/5a4efd26-d660-11e6-9fde-f6c9ca66fde1.png)


review ok.
@zhouxinyu I have edited my profile,you can look again.

@vintagewang   `super.connect` can throw NPE when remoteAddress is null, but as far as I see in netty code, it is ok (notification is raised). And the client handles this in `invoke*` methods by `throw new RemotingConnectException(addr);` (for instance, NettyRemotingClient lines 518-519).
To summarize, it looks safe.
@zhouxinyu @stevenschew Thanks, guys, https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/ROCKETMQ-36 is created to consider the improvement.
alright

Hi, @shroman 

About `e.printStackTrace()`, the error message should log to file surely, but can we keep the `e.printStackTrace()` if the call stack is in broker start process. IMO, print the error message to `stderr` will be more visualized, the developers can quick locate the reason why broker start failed.

And I have another question, why this PR prefer to use `+`  to concat string instead of using format string?

Hi @zhouxinyu 

I am not sure if I understand your 1st point though, but if you are saying about printing to `stdout` or `stderr` so that users can find problems with brokers from the command line, for instance, quickly,
I think this can be configured via logger xml configuration, right?

As for the 2nd point, I used `+` just because I am not sure what is the preferred way for the project -- both `+` and `{}` through the project. Shall we make a rule for this in http://rocketmq.apache.org/docs/code-guidelines/?
@shroman Please use parameterized template formatting way. See http://slf4j.org/faq.html section "What is the fastest way of (not) logging?"

The extracted shutdown hook misses required license header and causes check-style failure. Please fix it and double check if there are more similar code style issues.

You may refer [here](http://rocketmq.incubator.apache.org/docs/code-guidelines/) in terms of code style.
IMO, we should prefer slf4j or String.format effective format way to log in 4.x :-)

@wu-sheng Could you modify your PR , following our codestyle and PR guide[1] :-)

[1]http://rocketmq.incubator.apache.org/docs/code-guidelines/
@vongosling , fixed and done. Hoping `style-check` works well next time. ðŸ˜­
@vongosling I completely agree with you
Hi @iskl, please make sure the PR can pass the CI test.
@zhouxinyu Apologize... It's my mistake to use a wrong version of assertj.-core I've modified it to the correct version for jdk7 :)
ref issue https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/ROCKETMQ-44
Please follow instructions [here](http://rocketmq.incubator.apache.org/docs/pull-request/).
IMO, this  feature is not necessary, clientIP is only used in bornHost.
Hi, please resolve the conflicts and follow the rocketmq [codestyle](), and IMO, we need more discuss if we intent to add new feature to rocketmq-client module.

Hi, @lizhanhui , what's the appearance/effect of this BUG?

Let's start from the next round.

IMO, it's ok when ConsumeQueue-MappedFile hold failed, this file will be released by the last holder, while the empty mapped file will retain in MappedFileQueue, but the min consume queue offset will be corrected.

It seems that the only problem is the hanged consume queue only can be deleted when restart the broker.

Hi @tain198127, could you please use English in the pr title and commit logs?

Also please refer to [here](http://rocketmq.apache.org/docs/code-guidelines/) and [here](http://rocketmq.apache.org/docs/pull-request/) before sending a pull request to RocketMQ.

It seems ok, thanks @a2888409 

Please @vongosling @lizhanhui help review this PR.
@zhouxinyu, seems your style cause this. My intelliJ config is like this:
Hi, @lizhanhui , Let's handle this PR in RocketMQ-4.1.0 as a new feature.

It seems ok, thanks @naughtybear .

Please @vongosling @lizhanhui help review it.
How about discussing new features in dev mailing list before implementing them? Just my two cents ;)
@zhouxinyu , All travis-ci passed. Why style is still not correct?

> what's the appearance/effect of this BUG?

Reported bug description is consume queue files cannot be automatically deleted and took up large portion of disk.

> IMO, it's ok when ConsumeQueue-MappedFile hold failed, this file will be released by the last holder, while the empty mapped file will retain in MappedFileQueue, but the min consume queue offset will be corrected.

ConsumeQueue#correctMinOffset will not work as expected if consume queue file hanged.  Double check the source code to figure out.

> It seems that the only problem is the hanged consume queue only can be deleted when restart the broker.

Not only this one. As correcting min offset is also affected, consumer client probably experiences long term of "commit log being deleted." before consuming progress catches up. There should be additional potential issues.
@wu-sheng , sorry for my fault, I made some changes in intelliJ graph config page which doesn't reflect to the style file, anyway, I have updated the code style file, please check it.
Ok, I will sync this change to my pull requests. And check later.

I checked ConsumeQueue#correctMinOffset, and you are right this method won't work as expected in this situation.

Please @vintagewang @vongosling help review this PR.

Sorry, seem still not work. The close-brace style is OK, but `typecast`-style is still incorrect.
As I already mention on https://github.com/apache/incubator-rocketmq/pull/36, please check on that.

This is my local log:
```shell
[INFO] --- maven-checkstyle-plugin:2.17:check (verify) @ rocketmq-namesrv ---
[INFO] Starting audit...
/Users/wusheng/Documents/code/github/incubator-rocketmq-fork/namesrv/src/main/java/org/apache/rocketmq/namesrv/NamesrvStartup.java:103:47: error: 'typecast' is not followed by whitespace.
Audit done.

```
@zhouxinyu , just did it manually. It's crazy....
OK.

@tain198127 Could you follow other PR[1] style at first ?

[1] https://github.com/apache/incubator-rocketmq/pull/5
@lizhanhui Also please add some unit tests -:)..
Ready for review. Very trivial, but no need to have this double action.
It seems ok, please @vongosling @lizhanhui help review.

A suggestion: how about renaming this JIRA issue? This issue is for RemotingCommand, _'some'_ is very vague.
We can end up with many more _'some'_ tests in future :)
Looks good.

@shroman , issue-38 is for the whole rocketmq-remoting submoudle. The code already committed is the sample just for code style suggestion. I am writing the remaining test cases and nearly complete. For other submodules, I will create new issues~ :)

@vongosling @lizhanhui 
Please help review. Thanks.
alright
@shroman how do I find the dem mailing list and get involved
alright
@Jaskey just send an email to dev-subscribe@rocketmq.incubator.apache.org. See https://github.com/apache/incubator-rocketmq/blob/master/pom.xml
waitForRunning(0) is call wait(0). wait(0)  is wait forever util somenoe notify the Thread
Minor changes, appears OK.
Thanks @iskl @shroman @WillemJiang , I will work on the rocketmq remoting module these days.
@iskl It could be better if we narrow down `CHARSET_UTF8 ` access modifier to `private` and without `static`, for both `RocketMQSerializable` and `RemotingSerializable`.

@zhouxinyu , I have tried before. But there is a problem. In recent RocketMQ codes, there are no `ConsumeQueueMock` and `CommitLogMock`, I am not sure if I create the Mock-Classes, they are good enough.

If you want me to do that, I can try it, but no guarantee. Any thoughts? @vongosling @WillemJiang
@zhouxinyu , If your team member can provide these Mock-Classes, it will be easier to add test-cases for my changes.
